assign.name: Assignment #3: Use and review tech tools for managing differentiated instruction
assign.intro:
Identify two or more of the linked tech tools in the list below to differentiate instruction and try using them in your classroom. 

Write a reflection describing how you used the tools to differentiate instruction, rate the tools' effectiveness to meet your instructional goals, and post your reflection as well as your students’ comments or reactions to using the tools.

Groupings Tools

Grouping learners is one strategy that allows instructors to effectively differentiate instruction. Groupings should not be fixed; whole class, small groups, pairs, and collaboration with groups outside of the classroom can be used at different times throughout the term. The following resources can be used to create unique, flexible groupings within your classroom and with outside collaborators.

Encourage local and global collaboration by assigning online projects.

Pen Pal World  

Find a pen pal at Pen Pal World.

Quia Web   

Create your own online activities, quizzes, and more.

Online mini-classes allow you to develop customized learning environments that will increase interaction among learners.

Open Online Education                                                   

Check out the Online Course Kit to help you plan and design your online course.

WebQuest.Org                

Create an inquiry-oriented lesson in which most or all the information that learners work with comes from the web.

HyperDoc Templates    

Use these templates to create HyperDoc Lessons.

Moodle                               

Moodle allows you to develop online learning environments with features such as chats, forums, glossaries, journals, quizzes, surveys, and wikis.

TrackStar                            

TrackStar allows you to create online lessons and activities. Preview and collect websites, enter them into TrackStar, add annotations for your learners, create a quiz, and you have an interactive, online lesson called a Track. Create your own Track or use one of the hundreds of thousands already made by other educators. Search the database by subject, grade, or theme and standard for a quick and easy activity.

Diversity Tools

Every student brings his or her own unique strengths and weaknesses, and teachers must find ways to support these individual differences. In order to accommodate this diverse range of students, assistive and customizable tools are needed. The following resources will help to support all students in accessing the general curriculum.

Translation sites and multi-lingual content will provide linguistic support to your students.

Google Translate

There are many free translation sites such as Google Translate (preview them in advance of using with students as most support their services with online ads). Teach English language learners how to use these sites to support vocabulary development

Word2Word

Use online dictionaries in students' native languages to help build vocabulary and background knowledge. Word2Word is a syndication of multiple language dictionaries.

Individualize reading by offering various levels and supports.

BookBuilder

BookBuilder by CAST allows you to create engaging digital books with embedded, customizable strategic hints that build reading skills for students. See also the growing library of books created and shared.

Find learning, organization, and assistive technologies and application resources.

TechMatrix

The TechMatrix by AIR allows you to search by content area, grade level, accessibility feature, disability, product name and more in order to identify tools, research, and resources for your learners and your setting. Customize your matrix results, and share your search with colleagues.

Job Accommodation Network

This resource provides free, expert, and confidential guidance on workplace accommodations and disability employment issues.  JAN helps people with disabilities enhance their employability and shows employers how to capitalize on the value and talent that people with disabilities add to the workplace.

Variety of Expressions

The most successful way to assess learners’ knowledge is to provide them with multiple ways to demonstrate their learning. Offering different modes of expression that are relevant to learners’ lives may spark even greater engagement, creativity, interaction, and participation. The following resources can be used as creative options for student expression.

Put cameras into the hands of your students. Digital and cell phone cameras contribute to montages and video blogs and will enhance presentations.

1001 Uses for a Digital Camera

This site puts educators in touch with creative educational applications for digital cameras in educational settings. Submitted lessons and applications that have been used successfully in the classroom will be displayed for other educators to view and print

Kodak Lesson Plans

Kodak has developed a library of lessons that are enhanced through the use of cameras. Search by subject or grade, and use their teaching guide.

Increase interaction and participation through the use of web pages, blogs, wiki entries, ebooks, music, and podcasts. If you have an Internet connection, then you have what it takes to get learners creating their own online presence.

PBwiki

Start an ad-free wiki with pre-made templates, free videos, and lots of help. PBwiki lets you collaborate easily.

Blogger

Learn what a blog is and how to create your own in three easy steps at the blogger website.

ToonDoo     

Create an online comic strip or book with ToonDoo.

LetterPop

Design and create newsletters online with templates that allow users to concentrate on content rather than design.

Encourage your learners to create digital stories, personal narratives that are accompanied by visuals (photos, images or scanned artwork) and shared electronically.

Story Center

Use digital stories to motivate learners to share their stories in a unique and creative way. Digital stories can be used as alternatives for projects, summaries, and presentations. Get hooked on the power of digital stories with the premier Center.

Educational Uses of Digital Storytelling

Read about the educational uses, tutorials, links and resources for digital stories at the University of Houston.

Digital Storytelling Cookbook

Need some direction in creating a story? Use this step by step cookbook.

VoiceThread

Enhance your digital stories with VoiceThread, a tool that enables you to add voice to presentations, pictures, or text.
